intro: Hesperantha kilimanjarica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro lily, is a striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its foliage consists of narrow, strap-like leaves that are evergreen and contribute to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
